trial_identification.studytitle: Fondaparinux as an Anticoagulant in Haemofiltration in Patients With Acute Kidney Failure.
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Assessment of the Safety and Efficacy of Fondaparinux as an Anticoagulant in Haemofiltration in Patients With Acute Renal Failure.

interventions.interventions:
Treatment: drugs - Fondaparinux Sodium
Active Comparator: One - Enoxaparin Sodium (Clexane ) is to be used in the control arm of the study
Active Comparator: Two - Fondaparinux will be used as the anticoagulant in the sencond arm of the study
Treatment: drugs: Fondaparinux Sodium The active group of the study will be given fondaparinux 10mg/24 hours for haemofiltration anticoagulation

primaryOutcome.outcome: The study will evaluate the duration of filter patency using fondaparinux as an anticoagulant in haemofiltration and compare this to the current standard haemofilter anticoagulant, enoxaparin.

secondaryOutcome.outcome: To assess the incidence of complications, primary bleeding with fondaparinux compared to enoxaparin in this setting.

eligibility.inclusivecriteria:
1. Adult patients (18 years or over) admitted to the ICU and expected to stay for more than 48 hours.
2. Patients who require continuous renal replacement therapy.
3. Patients who consent or if the patient is not competent, the next of kin who consent to inclusion in the study. .
eligibility.exclusivecriteria:
1. Patients aged less than 18 years of age.
2. Patients who are pregnant
3. Patients with a contraindication to anticoagulation for pre existing bleeding diathesis
4. Patients or next of kin who do not consent to study inclusion. -

recruitment.hospital: The Royal Melbourne Hospital Intensive Care Unit Grattan Street - Parkville

ethicsAndSummary.summary: The purpose of this project is to assess the safety and effectiveness of fondaparinux, a new drug to prevent blood clotting in the continuous dialysis machine used in intensive care patients who have kidney failure.
